data.Name: Renewable freshwater resources flow
data.Definition: internal river flows and surface water from rainfall in the country. This flow is both permanent and seasonal surface water, including inflows from neighboring countries. The amount of freshwater in billion m3 that Uzbekistan withdraws annually for different purposes.

data.Name: Water stress
data.Definition: water withdrawal intensity. The level of water stress can show the degree to which the country exploits its water resources to meet water demand. This measures water withdrawal as a percentage of available water resources.  The SA also reports on this indicator as part of the clean water goal.

data.Name: Water consumption
data.Definition: the level of freshwater withdrawal by all major sectors (agriculture, domestic use, and industry) as a proportion of available freshwater resources. This measures the percentage of total freshwater withdrawal by main sectors. The indicator shows which sectors of the economy consume most of the freshwater.

data.Name: Water consumption
data.Definition: the level of freshwater withdrawal by all major sectors (agriculture, domestic use, and industry) as a proportion of available freshwater resources. This measures the percentage of total freshwater withdrawal by main sectors. The indicator shows which sectors of the economy consume most of the freshwater.

data.Name: Water consumption
data.Definition: the level of freshwater withdrawal by all major sectors (agriculture, domestic use, and industry) as a proportion of available freshwater resources. This measures the percentage of total freshwater withdrawal by main sectors. The indicator shows which sectors of the economy consume most of the freshwater.

data.Name: Forest area
data.Definition: the share of the total land area covered by forest. Forest resources are essential in regulating climate, protecting biodiversity and providing ecosystem services. Forest area (million hectares) percentage forest area as a share of total land area. The  indicator shows if Uzbekistan has experienced afforestation or massive deforestation over the years.

data.Name: Forest area
data.Definition: the share of the total land area covered by forest. Forest resources are essential in regulating climate, protecting biodiversity and providing ecosystem services. Forest area (million hectares) percentage forest area as a share of total land area. The  indicator shows if Uzbekistan has experienced afforestation or massive deforestation over the years.

data.Name: Forest stock
data.Definition: a stock of standing trees in forest areas with a certain diameter at breast height, measured in cubic metres (FAO). It is the volume over the bark of all living trees with a minimum diameter of 10 cm at breast height, including the stem from ground level up to a top diameter of 0 cm (excluding branches) (OECD). The indicator provides information about wood resources measured in millions of cubic metres (m3). It also provides the basis for estimating the amount of CO2 the forest contains.

data.Name: Land area
data.Definition: the FAO and World Bank databases define a land area as a country’s area, excluding area under inland water bodies (rivers and lakes). Uzbekistan follows a similar definition. Land resources are critical for food production, biodiversity conservation and carbon sequestration. Land includes natural and semi-natural vegetated land, bare land, cropland and artificial (built-up) surfaces. The indicator measures the inhabitable area of the country (km2), including the agriculture and forest area.

data.Name: Agriculture land
data.Definition: the share of land area that is arable (temporary crops), under permanent crops and permanent pastures (World Bank). This measures the percentage of land area available for agriculture (crops, orchards and pasture) in km2.

data.Name: Agriculture land
data.Definition: the share of land area that is arable (temporary crops), under permanent crops and permanent pastures (World Bank). This measures the percentage of land area available for agriculture (crops, orchards and pasture) in km2.

data.Name: Cultivated (arable) land
data.Definition: part of the agricultural land that is cultivated annually (arable land) for growing food and feed. Percentage of agriculture land cultivated for annual crops.

data.Name: Natural gas production and consumption
data.Definition: Volume (billion m3) of natural gas produced and consumed annually.

data.Name: Natural gas production and consumption
data.Definition: Volume (billion m3) of natural gas produced and consumed annually.

data.Name: Protected areas
data.Definition: national parks, nature reserves and wildlife sanctuaries designated by national authorities as scientific reserves with limited public access. Area (ha) and percentage of land area protected from open access to human activities.

data.Name: Threatened species
data.Definition: critically endangered and vulnerable species i.e., those plants and animals in danger of extinction or soon likely to be. Number of species (animal and plant) threatened by extinction among species assessed or known. The Ministry of Ecology, Environment Protection and Climate Change takes inventory periodically and publishes in the “Red Book”. The 5th edition was published in 2019.

data.Name: Threatened species
data.Definition: critically endangered and vulnerable species i.e., those plants and animals in danger of extinction or soon likely to be. Number of species (animal and plant) threatened by extinction among species assessed or known. The Ministry of Ecology, Environment Protection and Climate Change takes inventory periodically and publishes in the “Red Book”. The 5th edition was published in 2019.

data.Name: Annual mean temperature
data.Definition: annual mean surface temperature expressed in degree Celsius (°C).
